ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned both an overview of the global carbon cycle as well as more in-depth aspects of a few specific pieces of the global carbon cycle. I also learned about modeling.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course should have been better organized. The aim of this course was to provide the tools/knowledge to be able to perform modeling of geochemical systems. However, the instructors did not teach us neither to do modeling nor the essence and specifics of the geochemical systems modeling. It was a waste of time. I suggest that the instructors at least try to organize the course, begin with some geochemical background of the carbon cycle (as they did), then give some modeling background and tools (not just a list of existing techniques) that the students can experiment with and then expand on the geochemical modeling particularities. Once a solid background is achieved, each student could delve into its own project.

Strengths: Ed and Noah are nice and feel like some of my only professors who remember/understand what it's like to be a student. They both were willing to give extra help whenever I needed it, and checked in with me which was nice Weaknesses: Noah can be a bit unclear in his lectures sometimes. Hard to follow.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: No. For the weaknesses I listed in my answer to question #3.

This is a good class to take to get a broad understanding of many aspects of the global carbon cycle, as well as to learn about geochemical modeling. A low-key class, just a few homeworks, and you'll get as much out of it as you put in - don't have to put in much, but if you do you'll learn a lot
